text:
We have reverse proxy impleneted for external users in front of our oracle 
applications. Everything works fine except download / save PDF from The web 
server.

After downloading or opening PDF it throws an error. 
"There was an error in opening the document.The file is damaged and could not 
be repaired"
creator: mpunekar@ameren.com
nick@webthing.com
text: What leads you to suppose this has anything to do with Apache?

(In reply to comment #1)
> What leads you to suppose this has anything to do with Apache?

We are using APache web server as reverse proxy server. If we do not use 
reverse proxy I am able to download the file
creator: mpunekar@ameren.com
nick@webthing.com
text:
Can you please supply a URL for some PDF that shows the error, and the same PDF
served by something that works (e.g. as a static file)?
Inadequate info; tenuous link to Apache; no response to NEEDINFO.
creator: nick@webthing.com
mpunekar@ameren.com
text:
This has been resolved. Reverse proxy does some validation about the content-
length. Content-length in the header and actual data was different in size. 
Hence the PDF was not getting downloaded fully.

We have fixed Content-Length to match actual data and that has resolved the 
issue.

Thanks for the support.
